intro: Mouroucoa peteri, commonly known as the São Tomé starling tree, is a rare and endemic species found exclusively on the island of São Tomé. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree belonging to the family Rubiaceae, known for its ornamental value. The plant features glossy, elliptical leaves and produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule containing several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Mouroucoa peteri is considered a vulnerable species.
